Articles.Content:
Is it just me, or is there a MASSIVE sas effectiveness curve?

I mean, i can move a 30-ton ship just fine with only 2 large SAS units.

However, scale that up 20 times, with a 600-ton ship of the same shape and 80 large SAS units, and it turns about an eigth as fast.

does anyone know why this happens? or how to remove it?

Note that "SAS" is a KSP-ism. You're referring to reaction wheel strength. Squad tried to clean up their broken nomenclature but they missed some things. In actual aerospace terminology, "SAS" is a stability augmentation system, or basically an autopilot, which operates existing attitude control devices (control surfaces, RCS thrusters, etc). It cannot produce any torque on it's own without those devices.

Note that your much larger ship will have a bigger moment of inertia if it's of a larger size, which may have something to do with the issue. Plus Queso's note about lag..

(in stock play, it's rare for me to even use a single reaction wheel, the pod ones usually generate plenty of torque for upwards of 20-30 tons)
